content: hey DM crafters welcome to the DMS craft I'm a DM Scotty good to have you with me

the table and I'll show you how I do that
for this cabin I'm working on now I'm gonna do like a it's kind of like a
giant beaver nest so but I'm still doing the pillars the same way but I'm just

so I'll just cut through and this has heat settings on you want to try to get

know close up in your room there we go I got the general shape of that so now I
can work and I'm just basically doing it like the same I did the other pillar I'm
just kind of roughing it out a little bit not worried if I'm too exact and I
don't want to me just go straight a straight cut I want that kind of jagged

and I get a little bit of here and is in my previous video I don't like
the flattop so I'm gonna just cut that I'm just cutting a very thin a wafer
thin layer there and that just gives a little bit of
interest so it's not just totally flat I don't like the flats I like some detail
there all right so now there's a close-up that's ready now I'm not gonna
spray-paint this like I did the other one because I don't want that kind of
stony texture I do want to make this look like a wood because these are going
to be holding up what's kind of like a giant copse of trees that have crashed
in almost like a giant beaver nest in the middle of the woods so I'm gonna use
the engraving tool to put some interesting texture on that and I'll
show you I'll show you that next now this engraving tool has a sharp
point on it and it's almost like a drawing instrument so I've warmed this
up and I'm not gonna draw the the detail on this but I want you to watch so what
I'm gonna do is I'm trying to simulate branches inns and trees that have come
together to form the pillars of this giant beaver nest so I'll just start
just gonna start kind of pulling and I'm trying to do like branch shapes and then
the trick is I want them to kind of overlap so pulling like that
so the trick is to give the illusion that these are all a bunch of jumble and
branches all together so there you can see kind of got that little detail on
there and then you want to use this as kind of a guide see how this branch
comes down here so I might continue that all the way down through the piece and
then you can kind of take your cues from other pieces that might be coming
through there and so forth and so on so you just kind of continue it like a
jumbled bunch of branches and what I'll do is I'll continue this and then I will
I'll get it painted up and ready and then we'll I'll
show you how I detailed it now I've got it done you can also do a
little bit of dragging the point over the surface trying to get a little bit
of texture on there I don't get too aggressive because you don't want to
ruin up your cover-up your texture there but just that could give you a little
bit of extra interest all right I'm liking how that's looking
so I'm going to go ahead and a la base paint this black actually I've got a
base painted Brown dark brown and then I'll come back in and we'll do some
detail color so all right I'll see ya for the next stage
here's my pillar the stick pillar all dried up now I didn't
go back over this with the dark brown to get in some of the spaces that didn't
get filled when I initially did it it's a good idea when you do these deep cuts
like this that should do that because when it's wet you may not see those as
easily as when it's dry so I tend to wait till it's dry and then I go back
over it and fill in some spaces that I missed now you can see I didn't bother
to paint the bottom I really don't need to it's gonna be stuck to the tile so I
don't need to do that so now I'm just gonna use a big old brush and I would
ideally do all these at the same time and I'm just going to use a lighter
brown that's called spiced brown and I'll just load my brush up this is the
dry brush technique of course and just right over the surface like that and
there we go we're all set so I'll do another a little bit of
highlight before I put it on the tile but there you go you can really see that
texture popping out with the lighter brown against the dark so I'll do one
last step and then we'll show the tile with these up applied to them
you so I'm going to use some camel for
highlight I just want a little bit of a different color on there
just a touch I'm not putting too much on there just splash it on there a little
bit and like I say this always dry a little darker than it looks on camera
that's good that's all I really need so just a little touch now what I'm gonna
do is like I talked about in my previous Pilar's video I'm gonna apply these to
the tile I'm gonna go to the tile now and I'll talk about the tile itself but
I'll apply these just the same way I did for the pillars in the pillars video so
let's go to the tile and I'll talk about that
so here we go here's the tylenol that's Gloria it's a rather large tile so
basically the story behind it was this creature this legendary creature was in
the woods and there was this copse of trees that had fallen over and it had
built like almost like a giant beavers nest in the middle of the woods so the
players had to infiltrate the lair and try to kill it and I actually had three
encounters with it it caused a collapse in this area and
then fled and then they tricked they had to trace it to another area where it set
some traps and they had to fight that and all that so it was almost it was
like a three-part boss encounter which was really different which was really
neat at three different locations but this was the first location and look how
nice those those pillars look those they really look like branches that have been
cotton woven together I would imagine that the thing like you know well the
thing would actually used to secrete this like resin and that's how it kind
of put these this this nest together and actually were some traps later on that
uses the the creatures resin but I'm going to go I'm going to give a close-up
of the tile now and I'll I'll talk a little bit more so here we have a
close-up of the far end of the tile and this was the entrance that the the
creature came in it was like a it was like a tunnel that went underground so
the characters had to crawl through it and up into this layer and there was
light because there was some light that was streamed through the canopy of trees
that were collapsed over this nest so there was some dim light in here but I
also have these you can see my adventurers for size and you can see
this is a giant tile but it was a lot of fun gave a lot of room to maneuver
around especially for the creature it had like an ability to to disappear
blend into its surroundings it was very hard to track almost like invisibility
so it was a very difficult fight for the for the players but I also you can see I
have a little pile here and I made this is was supposed to simulate bones like
there were bones litter all over this layer and so what I did for this as I've
talked about before I just kind of smeared a little bit with the glue gun
and then did some dabs to kind of make like
dolls and then I basically paint it white and then use a like golden type
brown to give it that old bone look but you can see right here the the nice
pillars on the tile but they don't really obstruct play they're tall enough
to give you the illusion of the this is a it's this is actually higher than it
is so they give you the illusion that there's pillars but it's not too much to
obstruct play so it's still fairly easy to play on this tile even with these
these large obstructions on here so that's what I really like about doing
this this kind of technique it's not too crazy as far as getting in the way of
play so we you know just really scratch the surface on what you can do with this
the hot wire set in this foam and like I've mentioned before the foam is very
sturdy so you really don't need to reinforce it for the kind of things that
we're doing if you if you want something that's that's gonna last for years and
years and have a lot of where you can put you can get coatings and then hot
wire foam factory does sell coatings but for this for my tiles and things this
styrofoam is plenty sturdy to stand up to normal play and wear so I don't
really worry about it I just paint it over and I use it directly right into
the game but so I hope this gives you some ideas of what you can do with the
foam and the the tools especially the engraving tool gave us that nice woven
branch texture into the pillars so there we go there is our our wooden layer made
from tetris of trees and and and fallen branches so there we go and I'll see you
next time on the DMS craft hey guys if you're really digging these videos and
would like some more information or to talk to other crafters look at the link
below in the description and you can join my forum on the DM z-- craft we'd
